docs.abstract: Westchester County (NY) Executive Andrew J Spano, keeping campaign pledge to strengthen growing tourism industry, teams with Westchester Convention and Visitors Bureau to host tourism conference in October (S)
docs.lead_paragraph: Keeping a campaign pledge to expand Westchester's economy by strengthening the growing tourism industry, County Executive Andrew J. Spano said that his office and the Westchester Convention and Visitors Bureau will be the host to a tourism conference on Oct. 23, the county's first. The County Executive said the conference would afford the first official opportunity for tourism-related businesses to come together. Mr. Spano is working with Georgia G. Kalayjian, the president and chief operating officer of the Convention and Visitors Bureau, and Harold E. Vogt, the chief executive officer of the Westchester County Chamber of Commerce.

docs.lead_paragraph: ATHENS -- Tourist traffic in this land of ancient traditions and modern comfort is booming. In fact, the Greeks now look to tourism as their major source of income, with agriculture and industry following in that order.

headline.print_headline: Honolulu Shores Up Tourism With Crackdown on Homeless
headline.main: Honolulu Shores Up Tourism With Crackdown on Homeless

docs.abstract: Crackdown on Honolulu's homeless population, up 32 percent over past five years, is one of toughest police actions in nation; civic leaders say surge has led to aggressive panhandlers scaring off tourists; situation has sparked anguished debate on how to deal with homelessness in state that prides itself on its friendly and easygoing way of life.
docs.lead_paragraph: The homeless population has surged 32 percent in five years, and a crackdown has set off an anguished debate on how to deal with the destitute in a state that prides itself on friendliness.

byline.contributor: Nick Grube contributed reporting from Honolulu, and Frances Robles from Miami.

docs.abstract: Lr urges training of thousands of multilingual persons to spur tourism by non-Eng-speaking persons in US
docs.lead_paragraph: With all of the hullabaloo about getting people from other countries to visit the United States this coming summer by cutting transportation rates within the country in half, by reducing hotel rates for them, etc., two matters of major importance appear not to have received any consideration.
